First you have to import the Scanner.
Like so:

import static java.util.Scanner;

Then do the basic set up for a class like this:

[code]import static java.util.Scanner;

    public static void main(String args[]) {[/code]

Now for the use of the scanner.

[code]import static java.util.Scanner;

    public static void main(String args[]) {

          Scanner myScanner = new Scanner(in);

[/code]

Now you have to convert the info entered to a string. (Which kinda means more than one letter.)
You do that like this:

[code]import static java.util.Scanner;

    public static void main(String args[]) {

          Scanner myScanner = new Scanner(in);
          String Info = myScanner.next();

[/code]

Now you can use the text entered to do things.
Like this:

[code]import static java.lang.System.*;
import java.util.Scanner;

class CheckPassword {

public static void main(String args[]) {

    out.print("What's the password? ");

    Scanner myScanner = new Scanner(in);
    String password = myScanner.next();

    out.println("You typed >>" + password + "<<");
    out.println();


    if (password.equals("Javaiscool")) {
        out.println("The word you typed has the");
        out.println("same characters as the real");
        out.println("password. You can use our");
        out.println("precious system.");
    } else {
        out.println("The word you typed doesn't");
        out.println("have the same characters as");
        out.println("the real password. You can't");
        out.println("use our precious system.");
    }
}

}
[/code]

Have fun coding.
